meanings.definition: To weep over; to lament or mourn for.
meanings.sent1: She was beweeping the loss of her beloved pet.
meanings.sent2: The widow was beweeping at the gravesite of her husband.
meanings.sent3: The puppy started beweeping when its favorite toy got stuck under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The old tree seemed to be beweeping the passing of time with its falling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song made her beweeping uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: The beweeping child was comforted by their mother's embrace.
meanings.sent2: The beweeping sound of the violin echoed through the empty hall.
meanings.sent3: The beweeping clouds seemed to mirror the sadness in her heart.
meanings.sent4: His beweeping eyes revealed the depth of his sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The beweeping willow tree swayed gently in the breeze, as if shedding tears.
